name: A
description: Add ordered tests to the existing specimen

description: Lab to obtain specimen from patient

name: AA
description: Very abnormal (applies to non-numeric units, analogous to panic limits for numeric units)

name: null
description: No range defined, or normal ranges don't apply

name: C
description: Record coming over is a correction and thus replaces a final result

name: F
description: Final results; Can only be changed with a corrected result.

name: N
description: Not asked; used to affirmatively document that the observation identified in the OBX was not sought when the universal service ID in OBR-4 implies that it would be sought.

name: U
description: Results status change to final without retransmitting results already sent as ‘preliminary.’  E.g., radiology changes status from preliminary to final

name: W
description: Post original as wrong, e.g., transmitted for wrong patient

name: X
description: Results cannot be obtained for this observation

name: D
description: Message received, stored for later processing

name: L

name: LI
description: Link order to patient care problem or goal

name: SR
description: Response to send order status request (O02(Q06)

name: UN
description: Unlink order from patient care problem or goal

name: D
description: Same as R, also other associated segments

name: F
description: Same as D, plus confirmations explicitly

name: N
description: Only the MSA segment is returned

name: R
description: Same as E, also Replacement and Parent-Child

name: A
description: Some, but not all, results available

name: F
description: Final results; results stored and verified.  Can only be changed with a corrected result.

name: I
description: No results available; specimen received, procedure incomplete

name: O
description: Order received; specimen not yet received

name: P
description: Preliminary: A verified early result is available, final results not yet obtained

name: S
description: No results available; procedure scheduled, but not done

name: Y
description: No order on record for this test.  (Used only on queries)

name: Z
description: No record of this patient. (Used only on queries)

name: CART
description: Cart - patient travels on cart or gurney

name: PORT
description: The examining device goes to patient’s location

name: CX
description: Extended Composite ID With Check Digit

name: XCN

name: XON

Professional component included in charges and also billed separate to carrier

Medicare co-insurance amount in the first calendar year

Co-insurance amount in the second calendar year

Home health aide - home visit hours

name: COL
description: Collection date/time, equivalent to film or sample collection date/time

name: RCT
description: Specimen receipt date/time, receipt of specimen in filling ancillary (Lab)

name: REP
description: Report date/time, report date/time at filing ancillary (i.e., Lab)

name: CFN
description: Current final value, whether final or corrected

name: REV
description: All values within the range returned in reverse chronological order (This is the default if not otherwise specified.)

name: N
description: Substitutions are NOT authorized.  (This is the default - null.)
Substitution allowed - patient requested product dispensed
Substitution allowed - pharmacist selected product dispensed
Substitution allowed - generic drug not in stock
Substitution allowed - brand drug dispensed as a generic
Substitution not allowed - brand drug mandated by law
Substitution allowed - generic drug not available in marketplace

name: N
description: No substitute was dispensed.  This is equivalent to the default (null) value.

name: A
description: As soon as possible (a priority lower than stat)

name: B
description: Do at bedside or portable (may be used with other codes)

name: C
description: Measure continuously (e.g., arterial line blood pressure)

name: P
description: Preoperative (to be done prior to surgery)

name: T
description: Timing critical (do as near as possible to requested time)

name: A
description: Atomic test/observation (test code or treatment code)

name: C
description: Single observation calculated via a rule or formula from other independent observations (e.g., Alveolar--arterial ratio, cardiac output)

name: F
description: Functional procedure that may consist of one or more interrelated measures (e.g., glucose tolerance test, creatine clearance), usually done at different times and/or on different specimens

name: P
description: Profile or battery consisting of many independent atomic observations (e.g., SMA12, electrolytes), usually done at one instrument on one specimen

name: S
description: Superset--a set of batteries or procedures ordered under a single code unit but processed as separate batteries (e.g., routines = CBC, UA, electrolytes)

name: CMA
description: Clinical study with phases and scheduled master file

name: CMB
description: Clinical study without phases but with scheduled master file

name: REP
description: Replace current version of this master file with the version contained in this message

name: UPD
description: Change file records as defined in the record-level event codes for each record that follows

name: AL
description: Always.  All MFA segments (whether denoting errors or not) must be returned via the application-level  acknowledgment message

name: ER
description: Error/Reject conditions only.  Only MFA segments denoting errors must be returned via the application-level acknowledgment for this message

name: SU
description: Success.  Only MFA segments denoting success must be returned via the application-level acknowledgment for this message

name: MDC
description: Deactivate: discontinue using record in master file, but do not delete from database

name: S
description: Successful posting of the record defined by the MFE segment

name: U
description: Unsuccessful posting of the record defined by the MFE segment

name: BDL
description: Birth delivery location (address where birth occurred)

name: BR
description: Residence  at birth (home address at time of birth)

name: RH
description: Registry home.  Refers to the information system, typically managed by a public health agency, that  stores patient information such as immunization histories or cancer data, regardless of where the patient obtains services.

name: AP
description: Other application data, typically uninterpreted binary data  (new with HL7 v 2.3)

name: Application
description: Other application data, typically uninterpreted binary data  (HL7 V2.3 and later)

name: SGML
description: Structured Generalized Markup Language (HL7 V2.3 and later)

name: TEXT
description: Machine readable text document (HL7 V2.3.1 and later)

name: TX
description: Machine readable text document (HL7 V2.2 only)

name: Internet
description: Internet Address: Use Only If Telecommunication Use Code Is NET

name: X.400
description: X.400 email address: Use Only If Telecommunication Use Code Is NET

name: NNxxx
description: National Person Identifier where the xxx is the ISO table 3166  3-character (alphabetic) country  code

name: TF
description: technology fee for use of equipment

name: UP
description: unit price, may be based on length of procedure or service

name: not present
description: Not present (the default, meaning current  processing)

name: T
description: Current processing, transmitted at intervals (scheduled or on demand)

name: OK
description: Data found, no errors (this is the default)
The printable characters from the ISO 8859/1 Character set
The printable characters from the ISO 8859/2 Character set
The printable characters from the ISO 8859/3 Character set
The printable characters from the ISO 8859/4 Character set
The printable characters from the ISO 8859/5 Character set
The printable characters from the ISO 8859/6 Character set
The printable characters from the ISO 8859/7 Character set
The printable characters from the ISO 8859/8 Character set
The printable characters from the ISO 8859/9 Character set

name: ASCII
description: The printable 7-bit ASCII character set . (This is the default if this field is omitted)

name: ISO IR14
description: Code for Information Exchange (one byte)(JIS X 0201-1976),  Note that the code contains a  space, i.e. "ISO IR14".

name: ISO IR159
description: Code of the supplementary Japanese Graphic Character set for information interchange (JIS X  0212-1990), Note that the code contains a space, i.e. "ISO IR159".

name: ISO IR87
description: Code for the Japanese Graphic Character set for information interchange (JIS X 0208-1990), Note that the code contains a space, i.e. "ISO IR87".

name: UNICODE
description: The world wide character standard from ISO/IEC 10646-1-1993

name: D
description: The visit is marked for deletion and the user cannot enter new data against it.

name: I
description: The visit is marked inactive and the user cannot enter new data against it.

name: P
description: Marked for purge.  User is no longer able to update the visit.

name: BAY
description: Bayer Corporation (includes Miles, Inc. and Cutter Laboratories)

name: BPC
description: Berna Products Corporation (includes Swiss Serum and Vaccine Institute Berna)

name: JPN
description: The Research Foundation for Microbial Diseases of Osaka University (BIKEN)

name: PMC
description: Pasteur Merieux Connaught (includes Connaught Laboratories and Pasteur Merieux)

name: SI
description: Swiss Serum and Vaccine Inst. (inactive – use BPC)

name: USA
description: United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command

name: WAL
description: Wyeth-Ayerst (includes Wyeth-Lederle Vaccines and Pediatrics, Wyeth Laboratories, Lederle Laboratories, and Praxis Biologics)

name: I
description: Invasive procedure not classified elsewhere (I.V., catheter, etc.)

name: I
description: Invasive procedure not classified elsewhere (e.g., IV, catheter, etc.)

name: I
description: Incapacity which is significant, persistent or permanent

name: J
description: Disability which is significant, persistent or permanent

name: R
description: Required intervention to prevent permanent impairment/damage

name: M
description: Mid-level professional (nurse, nurse practitioner, physician's assistant)

name: A
description: Evaluation anticipated, but not yet begun

name: C
description: Product received in condition which made analysis impossible

name: D
description: Product discarded -- unable to follow up

name: I
description: Product remains implanted -- unable to follow up

name: K
description: Problem already known, no evaluation necessary

name: Q
description: Product under quarantine -- unable to follow up

name: U
description: Product unavailable for follow up investigation

name: A
description: Actual product involved in incident was evaluated

name: L
description: A product from the same lot as the actual product involved was evaluated

name: N
description: A product from a controlled/non-related inventory was evaluated

name: R
description: A product from a reserve sample was evaluated

name: DI
description: Product dose or frequency of use increased

name: DR
description: Product dose or frequency of use reduced

name: AW
description: Abatement of event after product withdrawn

name: EX
description: Alternative explanations for the event available

name: LI
description: Literature reports association of product with event

name: OE
description: Occurrence of event was confirmed by objective evidence

name: PL
description: Effect observed when patient receives placebo

name: SE
description: Similar events in past for this patient

name: TC
description: Toxic levels of product documented in blood or body fluids

name: * (star)
description: Life of the "unit."  Used for blood products.

name: PT
description: To identify measures at a point in time.  This is a synonym for "spot" or "random" as applied to urine measurements.

name: PEAK
description: The time post drug dose at which the highest drug level is reached (differs by drug)

name: RANDOM
description: Time from the challenge, or dose not specified. (random)

name: TROUGH
description: The time post drug dose at which the lowest drug level is reached (varies with drug)

name: CFST
description: Fasting (no calorie intake) for the period specified in the time component of the term, e.g., 1H POST  CFST

name: EXCZ
description: Exercise undertaken as challenge (can be quantified)

name: FFST
description: No fluid intake for the period specified in the time component of the term

name: CHECKUP
description: A routine check-up, such as an annual physical

name: FOLLOWUP
description: A follow up visit from a previous appointment

name: ROUTINE
description: Routine appointment - default if not valued

name: Complete
description: A request to add a completed appointment, used to maintain records of completed appointments

name: Normal
description: Routine schedule request type - default if not valued

name: Tentative
description: A request for a tentative (e.g., “penciled in”) appointment

name: Blocked
description: The indicated time slot(s) is(are) blocked

name: Cancelled
description: T7he indicated appointment was stopped from occurring (canceled prior to starting)

name: Complete
description: The indicated appointment has completed normally (was not discontinued, canceled, or deleted)

name: Dc
description: The indicated appointment was discontinued (DC’ed while in progress, discontinued parent appointment, or discontinued child appointment)

name: Deleted
description: The indicated appointment was deleted from the filler application

name: Overbook
description: The appointment has been confirmed; however it is confirmed in an overbooked state

name: Pending
description: Appointment has not yet been confirmed

name: Started
description: The indicated appointment has begun and is currently in progress

name: Waitlist
description: Appointment has been placed on a waiting list for a particular slot, or set of slots

name: Confirm
description: Contact the Placer Contact Person prior to making any substitutions of this resource

name: No
description: Substitution of this resource is not allowed

name: Notify
description: Notify the Placer Contact Person, through normal institutional procedures, that a substitution of this resource has been made

name: Yes
description: Substitution of this resource is allowed

name: DICOM
description: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

name: SGML
description: Structured General Markup Language (HL7 V2.3.1 and later)

name: XML
description: Extensible Markup Language (HL7 V2.3.1 and later)

name: FRI
description: An indicator that Friday is or is not preferred for the day on which the appointment will occur.  OK =  Preferred appointment day NO = Day is not preferred

name: MON
description: An indicator that Monday is or is not preferred for the day on which the appointment will occur.  OK = Preferred appointment day NO = Day is not preferred

name: PREFEND
description: The preferred end time for the appointment request, service or resource.  Any legal time specification in the format HHMM, using 24-hour clock notation

name: PREFSTART
description: The preferred start time for the appointment request, service or resource.   Any legal time specification in the format HHMM, using 24-hour clock notation

name: SAT
description: An indicator that Saturday is or is not preferred for the day on which the appointment will occur.  OK =  Preferred appointment day NO = Day is not preferred

name: SUN
description: An indicator that Sunday is or is not preferred for the day on which the appointment will occur.  OK = Preferred appointment day NO = Day is not preferred

name: THU
description: An indicator that Thursday is or is not preferred for the day on which the appointment will occur.  OK = Preferred appointment day NO = Day is not preferred

name: TUE
description: An indicator that Tuesday is or is not preferred for the day on which the appointment will occur.  OK = Preferred appointment day NO = Day is not preferred

name: WED
description: An indicator that Wednesday is or is not preferred for the day on which the appointment will occur. OK = Preferred appointment day NO = Day is not preferred

name: F
description: Flat-rate.  Apply the entire price to this interval, do not pro-rate the price if the full interval has not occurred/been consumed

name: P
description: Pro-rate.  Apply this price to this interval, pro-rated by whatever portion of the interval has occurred/been consumed

name: A
description: no encoding - data are displayable ASCII characters.

name: Base64
description: encoding as defined by MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) standard RFC 1521.  Four consecutive ASCII characters represent three consecutive octets of binary data.  Base64 utilizes a 65-character subset of US-ASCII, consisting of both the upper a

name: Hex
description: hexadecimal encoding - consecutive pairs of hexadecimal digits represent consecutive single octets.

name: DNS
description: An Internet dotted name. Either in ASCII or as integers

name: HCD
description: The CEN Healthcare Coding Scheme Designator. (Identifiers used in DICOM follow this assignment scheme.)

name: HL7
description: Reserved for future HL7 registration schemes

name: ISO
description: An International Standards Organization Object Identifier

name: L,M,N
description: These are reserved for locally defined coding schemes.

name: Random
description: Usually a base64 encoded string of random bits.  The uniqueness depends on the length of the bits.  Mail systems often generate ASCII string  "unique names," from a  combination of random bits and system names.  Obviously, such identifiers will not be con

name: F
description: Yes, patient has a living will but it is not on file

name: I
description: No, patient does not have a living will but information was provided

name: N
description: No, patient does not have a living will and no information was provided

name: Y
description: Yes, patient has a living will

name: F
description: Yes, patient is a donor, but card is not on file

name: I
description: No, patient does not have a living will but information was provided

name: Y
description: Yes, patient is a donor and card is on file

name: IMP
description: Implant: can be used for radiation implant patients

name: INF
description: Infectious disease: this location can be used for isolation

name: PRL
description: Privacy level: indicating the level of private versus non-private room

name: SHA
description: Shadow: a temporary holding location that does not physically exist

Patient has been informed of responsibility, and agrees to pay for service
Patient has been informed of responsibility, and asks that the payer be billed
Advanced Beneficiary Notice has not been signed
Natural child/Insured does not have financial responsibility
Minor dependent of a minor dependent
Approved by the PSRO/UR as billed
Automatic approval as billed based on focused review
No fault insurance involved-including auto accident/other
Date of onset for a chronically dependent individual
Date outpatient occupational therapy plan established or last reviewed
Date benefits terminated by primary payor
Date outpatient physical therapy plan established or last reviewed
Date outpatient speech pathology plan established or last reviewed
Date beneficiary notified of intent to bill (accommodations)
Date beneficiary notified of intent to bill (procedures or treatments)
First day of the Medicare coordination period for ESRD beneficiaries covered by EGHP
Date of election of extended care facilities
Date of inpatient hospital discharge for covered transplant patients
Date of inpatient hospital discharge for non-covered transplant patient
Date of first test for pre-admission testing
Date treatment started for cardiac rehab.
Date treatment started for psychiatric care

name: <null>
description: This is the default, indicating that there is no character set switching occurring in this message.

name: ISO 2022-199
